slides.title: Welcome to XM Cloud Fundamentals
slides.content: Your journey to mastering Sitecore's cloud-native CMS platform
slides.notes: This course covers everything from basic concepts to deployment.

slides.title: What is XM Cloud?
slides.content: Sitecore's cloud-native, SaaS content management platform
bullets: Fully managed, scalable solution for digital experience management
Eliminates the need for infrastructure management
Significant evolution in the Sitecore ecosystem
Focus purely on building great digital experiences
slides.notes: XM Cloud represents a shift from on-premise to cloud-first.

slides.title: Why Choose XM Cloud?
bullets: Cloud-Native: Built for the cloud from the ground up
SaaS Delivery: No server management required
Developer Experience: Modern tooling and frameworks
slides.notes: Key differentiators from traditional Sitecore installations.

slides.title: Headless Architecture
bullets: Content management backend separated from frontend presentation
Use modern frameworks: React, Next.js, Vue, Angular
Content authors use familiar Sitecore experience
Developers have full control over the frontend
slides.notes: The headless approach is the key differentiator of XM Cloud.

slides.title: Three Core Components
slides.content: XM Cloud architecture consists of three main components
bullets: Content Management (CM): Backend authoring environment for content creation
Experience Edge: Globally distributed CDN serving content via GraphQL APIs
Pages: Visual page builder for marketers to compose without developers
slides.notes: Each component serves a specific purpose in the content lifecycle.

slides.title: Content Management (CM)
slides.content: The authoring environment for content teams
slides.notes: CM is where content authors spend most of their time.

slides.title: Experience Edge & Pages
bullets: Experience Edge: Global CDN for content delivery
Experience Edge: GraphQL and REST APIs
Experience Edge: Edge caching for performance
slides.notes: Edge handles delivery while Pages empowers marketers.

slides.title: Required Development Tools
slides.content: Essential tools for XM Cloud development
bullets: VS Code or preferred code editor
slides.notes: Ensure all tools are installed before starting development.

slides.title: Project Initialization
slides.content: Creating a new XM Cloud project
bullets: Use the official Sitecore JSS scaffolding tool
slides.notes: This command sets up a complete project structure.

slides.title: Starter Template Features
slides.content: What you get out of the box
bullets: Routing setup with Next.js App Router
slides.notes: The starter template accelerates development significantly.

slides.title: JSS Component Model
bullets: Components built using React or Next.js
Each component maps to a Sitecore rendering
Fields contain content defined in Sitecore
slides.notes: Understanding the component model is crucial for development.

slides.title: Basic JSS Component
bullets: Import field helper components from JSS
Use Text and RichText helpers for content
slides.notes: This pattern is the foundation of all JSS components.

slides.title: Field Helper Components
slides.content: JSS provides helpers for different field types
bullets: Image - Image fields with responsive support
slides.notes: Use the appropriate helper for each field type.

slides.title: Experience Editor Support
slides.content: Enabling inline editing for content authors
bullets: Field helpers add necessary metadata automatically
Content authors can edit directly on the page
No additional configuration needed when using helpers
slides.notes: Always use field helpers to maintain editor compatibility.

slides.title: XM Cloud Deploy
slides.content: Cloud-based CI/CD for XM Cloud applications
bullets: Connects directly to your GitHub repository
slides.notes: XM Cloud Deploy simplifies the deployment process significantly.

slides.title: Deployment Pipeline
slides.content: From code to production in minutes
bullets: Step 1: Push code to GitHub repository
Step 2: XM Cloud Deploy detects the change
Step 4: Application deployed to Experience Edge
Step 5: Content available via GraphQL API
slides.notes: The entire process typically takes just a few minutes.

slides.title: Environment Configuration
slides.notes: Proper environment configuration ensures secure deployments.

slides.title: Course Summary
slides.content: Key takeaways from XM Cloud Fundamentals
bullets: XM Cloud is Sitecore's cloud-native, headless CMS
Three core components: CM, Experience Edge, Pages
Field helpers enable Experience Editor support
XM Cloud Deploy provides automated CI/CD
Content delivered globally via Experience Edge CDN
slides.notes: Congratulations on completing XM Cloud Fundamentals!
